meanings.definition: A person who tells someone to be quiet.
meanings.sent1: The shushers in the library remind people to lower their voices.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the shushers to keep the classroom calm.
meanings.sent3: The shushers at the movie theater had to shush a group of giggling friends.
meanings.sent4: The park ranger acted as a shusher, silencing the noisy campers.
meanings.sent5: The shushers at the concert gestured for the audience to hush during the performance.

meanings.sent1: The group of shushers gathered to discuss their strategy for maintaining silence.
meanings.sent2: The shushers were vigilant in ensuring the event remained peaceful.
meanings.sent3: The shushers formed a line to quiet down the rowdy crowd.
meanings.sent4: The team of shushers worked together to hush any disturbances.
meanings.sent5: The shushers wore badges identifying them as the quiet enforcers of the venue.
